TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
23 Seint fid[es][6 Octob.]
SEinte Fey, þat holie Maide &punctelev; of swiþe hei&yogh;e men heo com
Swiþe &yogh;ong in hire childhod &punctelev; heo turnede to cristindom
And holi lijf inou heo ladde— &punctelev; þat word sprong wel wide
Of hire guodnesse and of hire holi lijf &punctelev; aboute in eche side
¶ A luþer Aumperour þare was þo &punctelev; þat hiet Dioclician
And is felawe þat was also &punctelev; þe schrewe Maximian
A luþur Iustise huy hadden with heom &punctelev; is name was dacian
To deþe huy brou&yogh;ten &yogh;ware huy founden &punctelev; ani cristine Man
¶ Þe Iustise Dacian &punctelev; wende intal[= into al] þe lond
And aslou&yogh; alle þe cristine men &punctelev; þat he ou&yogh;were fond
So þat he heorde telle &punctelev; ase he wende bi þe wey
Of þis holie maide and clene &punctelev; and icristned, seinte Fey
¶ To þe toune þare heo was inne &punctelev; ase a wod man he wende
And burstinde in grete wrathþe &punctelev; is bedeles aboute he sende
To crie aboute in eche strete &punctelev; &yogh;if men mi&yogh;hte ani finde
Cristine man oþur womman &punctelev; þat huy heom scholden faste binde
And bifore him bringue hasteliche— &punctelev; þat huy ne sparede non!
And bote huy wolden heore [þou&yogh;t] tuyrne &punctelev; anoþur it scholde gon
¶ Þo þe banne was þus icried &punctelev; þare was Ioye Inou&yogh;
Among þe paeyns euerechone &punctelev; þat Man cristine men so aslou&yogh;
Ake seoruwe and sor and deol inou&yogh; &punctelev; among cristine men þare was
Þo huy sei&yogh;en heore deth icome &punctelev; and non oþur bote þare nas
¶ Seinte Fey was furst isou&yogh;t &punctelev; for men wusten of hire wel wide
Ioyful heo was and glad inou&yogh; &punctelev; þo men þe banne criede
Ake forth heo wende wel baldeliche &punctelev; nolde heo nou&yogh;t longue abide
Ake profrede hire to þe tormentores &punctelev; ase men sou&yogh;ten hire wide
With hardie heorte heo wende forth. &punctelev; þe tormentores hire nome
And harleden hire wel filliche &punctelev; forth toward hire dome
¶ Þe Iustise for wrathþe wende[r. vemde] þo &punctelev; heo bifore him come
heo made þe signe of þe croiz &punctelev; and blessede hire ilome
heo bad ore louerd wel mildeliche &punctelev; þat he ire &yogh;eue þere
Studefaste bileue and strencþe of heorte &punctelev; þat heo ouercome nere
And in hire tormenz treowe heorte &punctelev; and þat he ire &yogh;eue is grace
To his onour answerie wel &punctelev; þe Iustise in þat place
¶ Þe Iustise biheold þat Maide &punctelev; with ful sori chere
he grennede and femde touward hire &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht ase he wod were
"Dameisele," he seide, "&yogh;wat art þou? &punctelev; &yogh;wat þencstþou forto do
Tel me on &yogh;wam þou bilieuest &punctelev; and &yogh;wat is þi name, also."
"Sire," seide þis holie Maide &punctelev; "Fey ich hote nouþe
And cristine womman ich habbe ibeo &punctelev; sethþe ich ani guod couþe
Mi name nelle ich nou&yogh;t forsake &punctelev; no mi cristindom noþur
Þou mi&yogh;ht þretne al þat þou wolt &punctelev; of me ne worth þe non oþur."
¶ Þo bigan þis Dacian &punctelev; fair semblaunt to make
"Maide," he seide, "ich rede þe &punctelev; þat þou an oþur red take
Þench þat þou art fair and noble &punctelev; and þat þe bet bicome
A noble lauedi to beon and hei&yogh;h &punctelev; þane beo ibrou&yogh;t here to dome
For &yogh;if þou wolt don aftur me &punctelev; in grete Ioie þou worst ibrou&yogh;t
And in grete nobleie, ase þe bicometh— &punctelev; þarefore torne þi þou&yogh;t."
¶ "Certes, sire," þis maide seide &punctelev; "þou spext embe nou&yogh;t
For inelle neuere him forsake &punctelev; þat so deore me hathþ abou&yogh;t
For ich habbe to him mi vou imaked &punctelev; þat inelle neuere breke
Þare[r. þarefore] do elles &yogh;wat þou wolt &punctelev; bote þat þou þarof ne speke
For Inelle nou&yogh;t honouri þine false godes. &punctelev; for in þe sautere it is iwrite
Þat alle swuche Deouele beoth &punctelev; and þat may ech Man iwite."
¶ Þo fierde þe Iustise ase he were wod &punctelev; and made wel sori bere
And was neih&yogh; wod for þis Maide seide &punctelev; þat is godes deuelene were
he liet fette a bed of bras &punctelev; brod and hei&yogh;h also
And dude strepe þis Maide naked &punctelev; and in þis harde bedde ire do
¶ Þis Maide, þo heo naked was &punctelev; with glad semblaunt in wende
huy strei&yogh;hten hire along and acroiz &punctelev; and gret fuyr þareonder tende
And casten on grece riue inou&yogh; &punctelev; þat drof up so gret lei&yogh;e
Þat þis maide þou&yogh;te al afuyre &punctelev; ase huy þat stoden þare isei&yogh;e
Þe tormentores stoden þarebiside &punctelev; with kene oules and strongue
And tur[n]den þat Maide side and oþur &punctelev; ouer þe fuyre wel longue
Þat heo þoru&yogh; strencþe of þe grece &punctelev; ofte al afuyre stod
Euere lai þat holie Maide &punctelev; ase hire nere nou&yogh;t bote guod
hire heu heo nolde chaungi enes &punctelev; ne tuyrne hire þou&yogh;t
Alle men þat þe wonder iseien &punctelev; þe enchesun nusten nou&yogh;t
¶ Cristine men manie &punctelev; þo huy herden telle
Þat þe Iustise was þudere icome &punctelev; with tormenz heom to quelle
huy ornen out of toune hem forto huyde &punctelev; ech in is side, for doute
And lei&yogh;en in puttes and in olde diches &punctelev; &yogh;eont al þe contreie a|boute
An holi man þare hudde him so &punctelev; þat men cleopeden capras
Þat in þe northside of þe toun &punctelev; in one olde roche he was
¶ He lai and darede out of is hole &punctelev; ase he dorste for doute
And isai&yogh; al þe torment of seinte Fey &punctelev; ase he [biheold aboute,[om. (so Ash.)]
hou men rosteden hire with fuyr and grece &punctelev; and todrowen hire also
For it was a luyte þarebiside &punctelev; þat þis dede was ido
Ase þis fuyr bigan to brenne &punctelev; þis holie man isei&yogh;
A coluere þare cam, so &yogh;wijt so milk &punctelev; fram heouene fleo on hei&yogh;
¶ A croune of guold heo bar adoun &punctelev; þat schinde swiþe bri&yogh;hte
Bri&yogh;htore þane þe sonne leom. &punctelev; oppe þe maidenes heued[Ash. maide heo] ali&yogh;hte
And sette þe croune on hire heued &punctelev; with þe winguen heo bleu faste
A&yogh;ein þat fuyr, ase him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat it ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t ilaste
Framward þat Maide heo bleu it euere &punctelev; þat it ne cam hire noþing nei&yogh;h
And heo lai þare in alle Ioye &punctelev; ase þis holie man isei&yogh;h
Þarefore oþure þat weren hire nei&yogh;h &punctelev; nusten nou&yogh;t hou it was
Þat þou&yogh;te þat heo was al afuyre &punctelev; and neuere þe worse hire nas
¶ Þis holie man seint capras &punctelev; þat isei&yogh;h al þis
to himseolf he seide, "ich abide &punctelev; nou sone to longue, iwis;"
he sturte out of þis deope Roche &punctelev; and þudere or[n] wel faste
to þis tormentingue sone he cam &punctelev; noþing him ne agaste
Loude he gradde with folle Mouth &punctelev; "Ich am cristine Man
Inelle forsake Ihesu crist &punctelev; for drede of Dacian
To longue ich habbe heonne ibeo— &punctelev; þat me forþuncheth sore
here is Ioye and blisse inou&yogh;h &punctelev; þat schal bringue us to more."
¶ Tweie breþren þare comen þo also &punctelev; seint Felician
And seint prime &punctelev; þat seide also to þis Dacian
Wodwrothþ was Dacian þo &punctelev; he dude heom nime echon
Seinte Fey and alle þe oþere &punctelev; and smiten of heore heuedes anon
Þe tormentores iredie weren &punctelev; and gonne þat maide take
And hire felawes forth with hire &punctelev; þat nolden ore louerd forsake
And ladden heom forth to heore endeday &punctelev; and heore heuedes smiten of sone
In gret wrathþe ech aftur oþur &punctelev; and duden heore maistres bone
¶ To þe Ioye of heouene anon huy wenden &punctelev; and þare bileue with|outen ende
Aungles þare weren to bere heom forthþ &punctelev; þat ore louerd þudere gan siende
Þe luþere men leten þe bodies ligge &punctelev; þo huy weren ibrou&yogh;t of dawe
In a foul stude al onbured &punctelev; þare bestes heom scholden todrawe
Ake cristine men þat þare weren nei&yogh;h &punctelev; þerto stelen bi ni&yogh;hte
And bureden heom in a derne stude &punctelev; ase nobleliche ase huy mi&yogh;hten
Nou seinte Fey and hire felawes &punctelev; ore erinde beode so
Þat we moten to þe Ioye come &punctelev; þare huy beoth inne ido
